item.title: OSPF Deep dive - 1
item.description: OSPF (Open Shortest Path First) is a link-state routing protocol that’s still super relevant in today‚Äôs world of networking. I know it can feel a bit overwhelming, but don‚Äôt worry ‚Äì I‚Äôll break it down for you in this blog. We‚Äôll dive into both the theory and the practical side of things, and I‚Äôll try to make it as easy to understand as possible. Hopefully, by the end, you‚Äôll have a solid grasp on OSPF and why it‚Äôs so important.

item.title: How to craft an effective lie
item.description:
When crafting a lie, keep it believable, no sensationalism, romanticizing, or anticipating the recipient’s feelings. State it like a wildlife report: factual, detached, and unembellished.

‚ùå : It was a young giraffe who loved her parents and wanted to become a doctor üò≠ü•∫üíî

‚úÖ : The Lion ate the giraffe

item.title: Linux || xxd || How to create and reverse hexdump files
item.description:
In this post I aim to explain what and how to interact with hex dump files and to solve a simple challenge to enforce learning.

What’s a hexdump exactly

A hex dump is a textual representation of data in hexadecimal format, often used for inspecting files or binary data. It’s especially useful for debugging and reverse engineering.

However, a hex dump is not the same as a HEX file format. Instead, think of a hex dump as a way to view the binary data of a file in hexadecimal form, making it easier to read and analyze.

item.title: Re-reading exercise articles compilation
item.description:
In this post, I’ve compiled a list of articles I use for my re-reading exercise‚Äîarticles intentionally difficult to read, often filled with jargon, HR-related topics, and dense regulations. The goal is to build focus and patience by revisiting these challenging reads. I recommend using the reader mode whenever possible, the below list is continuously updated:

1 - https://mindofhr.com/2023/12/revolutionizing-human-resources-with-scrum-a-comprehensive-exploration/

item.title: Snap Out of It! How I‚Äôm Learning to Thrive in Boredom Instead of Scratching It Away
item.description:
The Pit

Books unread, movies unwatched, and abandoned projects‚Äîwhy? When did I become so easily distracted? When did enjoyable activities and hobbies become a chore? And when did we become pawns, so easily influenced and signed over our attention and focus, letting corporations make money off it for free?

Attention is a highly valued asset, so no wonder the marketing industry is valued at $481 billion. From influencers sharing referral links for lip gloss in shades identical to countless others, to politicians dividing people with inflammatory comments, and then there‚Äôs a cute kitten hopping into a box‚Äîall within a minute of scrolling through Instagram. It‚Äôs no surprise we feel our attention slipping away.

item.title: Unlocking Visual Creativity in 2023 with ChatGPT : Exploring the New DALL-E Feature in ChatGPT
item.description:
What is DALL-E 3 and how can I use DALL-E 3 in ChatGPT?

DALL-E 3, developed by OpenAI, is a groundbreaking AI system capable of generating realistic images and art from natural language descriptions. In my latest video, I experimented with the same DALL-E 3 prompts featured in a recent blog post to evaluate its integration with ChatGPT.
